analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi legs pa brjod pa yin /

translated: I too am practicing the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.🔽I also encourage others to acquire the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks, and I praise the acquisition of the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: sems can gzhan gang mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu bsgrub pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod pa yin /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rtag tu rgyun mi chad par bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: They constantly and always serve the lord buddhas

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: and go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos pa de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe rabs brjes @379b kyang nam du'ang rnam par chud mi za ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos thos pa de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe rabs brjes @379b kyang nam du'ang rnam par chud mi za ste /
translated: and even after they have changed lives, they never lose that Dharma that they have heard from those lord buddhas until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzungs thob cing lus kyi dbang po'am /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gzungs thob cing lus kyi dbang po'am /
translated: They always and constantly obtain the dhāraṇīs and do not lose the faculty of body,

original: ngag gi dbang po'am /
analyzed: ngag gi dbang po'am /
translated: do not lose the faculty of speech,

original: yid kyi dbang po mi nyams pa yin /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po mi nyams pa yin /
translated: and do not lose the faculty of mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu bsgoms pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu bsgoms pas /
translated: it is because those bodhisattva great beings always and constantly cultivate the knowledge of path aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu bsgoms pa de lam thams cad shin tu bsgoms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu bsgoms pa de lam thams cad shin tu bsgoms par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who cultivate the knowledge of path aspects cultivate all paths.

original: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam mam /
translated: They cultivate the śrāvaka path,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mam /
translated: they cultivate the pratyekabuddha path,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mam /
translated: they cultivate the bodhisattva path,

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam shin tu bsgoms par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam shin tu bsgoms par 'gyur /
translated: they will thoroughly cultivate the path to buddhahood.

original: mngon par shes pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la rnam par chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis phan par 'gyur ba de dag kyang shin tu bsgoms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la rnam par chud mi za ba'i tshul gyis phan par 'gyur ba de dag kyang shin tu bsgoms par 'gyur te /
translated: They will thoroughly cultivate the superknowledges that will benefit the bodhisattva great beings by means of the method of non-forgetting.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa de dag la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa de dag la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don byed na /
translated: Abiding in those superknowledges that arise from the ripening of karma, they will work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'khor yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las kyang yongs su mi nyams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'khor yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las kyang yongs su mi nyams so //
translated: Even though they will circle in the five classes of transmigrating beings, they will not regress from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
translated: they abide in the emptiness of inherent nature

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: and work for the welfare of sentient beings by means of skillful means.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽rang bzhin @380a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / rang bzhin @380a *//
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
translated: they abide in the emptiness of inherent nature

original: sems can shes rab 'chal pa can blo chung pa rnams mthong na /
analyzed: sems can shes rab 'chal pa can blo chung pa rnams mthong na /
translated: and, when they see beings with poor wisdom and little intelligence,

original: 'di skad 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad 'dems shing rjes su ston te /
translated: they instruct and teach them as follows:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu; lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las gang ci byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu; lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las gang ci byed kyang rung ste /
translated: ‘Come, son of good family! Whatever actions you do, whether of body, speech, or mind,

original: de thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs shig dang / khyod kyi las thams cad bdud rtsi'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rtogs shig dang / khyod kyi las thams cad bdud rtsi'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: realize them all as the emptiness of inherent nature, and all your actions will bear the fruit of immortality

original: mthar bdud rtsir 'gyur ro //🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni gang 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mthar bdud rtsir 'gyur ro // rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni gang 'jig par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: and will end in immortality.🔽In the emptiness of inherent nature, no phenomenon whatsoever can be apprehended that would be destroyed

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang dmigs su med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gang yang dmigs su med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: or deteriorate. And why is that?

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
translated: The emptiness of inherent nature does not deteriorate.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyang gang yang med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyang gang yang med do //
translated: There is no dharma at all that is lost through emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni dngos po yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ni dngos po yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Because emptiness is not a thing,

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin /
translated: it is not a non-thing,

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la ci zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la ci zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes /
translated: and what is the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, that is not nonexistent.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la 'dems shing rjes su ston to //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la 'dems shing rjes su ston to //
translated: with skillful means, instruct and teach beings.

original: de ltar 'dems shing rjes su ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar 'dems shing rjes su ston pa'i tshe /
translated: When they instruct and teach like that,

original: nam yang rjes su ma bsgrubs pa ma yin /🔽de ni bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing @380b gnas pa yin /
analyzed: nam yang rjes su ma bsgrubs pa ma yin / de ni bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing @380b gnas pa yin /
translated: they never fail to accomplish it.🔽They themselves take up and live the ten wholesome actions,

original: gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: and they encourage others to take up the ten wholesome actions.

original: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gnas lnga yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bslab pa'i gnas lnga yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
translated: I myself have taken up and abide in the five precepts.

original: gzhan yang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bslab pa'i gnas lnga la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to take up the five precepts.

original: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyin la nye bar gnas pa yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyin la nye bar gnas pa yang dag par blangs shing gnas pa yin /
translated: I myself have taken up and abide in the observance of the poṣadha that is endowed with the eight sections.

original: gzhan yang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyin la nye bar gnas par yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyin la nye bar gnas par yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to take up the observance of the poṣadha that is endowed with the eight sections.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: I myself enter into the first concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang po la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to enter into the first concentration.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: I myself enter into the second concentration, the third concentration, and the fourth concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I also encourage others to enter into the fourth concentration.

original: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par byams pa la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par byams pa la gnas pa yin /
translated: I myself always abide in loving kindness.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par byams pa bsgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par byams pa bsgom pa la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They are those who constantly and always encourage others to cultivate love.

original: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la gnas pa yin /
translated: They themselves constantly and always abide in compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par btang snyoms bsgom pa la yang dag par bskul pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu rgyun mi chad par btang snyoms bsgom pa la yang dag par bskul pa yin /
translated: They are those who constantly and always encourage others to cultivate equanimity.

original: bdag kyang rtag tu nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa @381a *//
analyzed: bdag kyang rtag tu nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa @381a *//
translated: They themselves constantly and always abide in the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space, the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness, the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothing-at-all,

original: dang; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: dang; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yin /
translated: and the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gzhan yang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la yang dag par bskul pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la yang dag par bskul pa yin /
translated: They are those who constantly and always encourage others to cultivate the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: bdag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bsgom pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la bsgom pa yin /
translated: I myself should practice the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yang dag par bskul pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la yang dag par bskul pa yin /
translated: I should also encourage others to practice the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: bdag kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la slob pa yin /
translated: I myself should train in the three doors of perfect liberation.

original: gzhan yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I should also encourage others to train in the three doors of perfect liberation.

original: bdag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la slob pa yin /
translated: I myself should train in the noble truths, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the clairvoyances, the concentrations, and the doors of retention.

original: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo rnams la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: I should also encourage others to train in the doors of retention.

original: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la slob pa yin /
translated: I myself should train in the ten powers of the tathagatas.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They are also encouraging others to develop the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: bdag kyang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la slob pa yin /
translated: They are training in the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang dag par @381b bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la yang dag par @381b bskul ba yin /
translated: They are also encouraging others to develop the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: bdag kyang mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la slob pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la slob pa yin /
translated: They are training in the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: gzhan yang mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la yang dag par bskul ba yin /
translated: They are also encouraging others to develop the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor marks.

original: bdag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing /
analyzed: bdag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing /
translated: They are producing the knowledge of the result of stream enterer.

original: de la mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa yin /
translated: They are not remaining in that.

original: gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god pa yin; bdag kyang lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'god pa yin; bdag kyang lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i shes pa bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
translated: and they themselves produce the knowledge of the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the result of arhat, but they do not remain in it.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god pa yin /
translated: Moreover, they establish others in the result of arhat.

original: bdag kyang rang byang chub kyi lam bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang rang byang chub kyi lam bskyed cing de la mi gnas pa yin /
translated: They themselves produce the path to a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, but they do not remain in it.

original: gzhan yang rang byang chub la rab tu 'god pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang byang chub la rab tu 'god pa yin /
translated: Moreover, they establish others in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam bskyed pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam bskyed pa yin /
translated: They themselves produce the path to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gzhan yang lam de la 'dems shing rjes su ston pa dang / gzhog cing 'dul ba dang 'god pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lam de la 'dems shing rjes su ston pa dang / gzhog cing 'dul ba dang 'god pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, they recommend and teach that path to others, and they establish them in it.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing like that practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: From the first production of the thought of awakening

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
translated: up to the time of abiding in the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'i tshe //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'i tshe //
translated: when working for the welfare of sentient beings,

original: nam yang las med par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang las med par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: one never abides in the absence of action.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are empty of inherent nature,

original: rang @382a *// bzhin stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: rang @382a *// bzhin stong pa nyid la ni sems can yang mi dmigs /
translated: in the emptiness of inherent nature sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: chos kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: chos kyang mi dmigs /
translated: phenomena are not apprehended,

original: chos ma lags pa de'ang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: chos ma lags pa de'ang mi dmigs na /
translated: and even non-phenomena are not apprehended,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du yang dag par 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du yang dag par 'jug pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings engage in the pursuit of the knowledge of all aspects?🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so,

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty of inherent nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni sems can mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la ni sems can mi dmigs so //
translated: In the emptiness of inherent existence, sentient beings are not found.

original: chos mi dmigs so //

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

analyzed: skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //

analyzed: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya bar chos ston to //

analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te nang stong pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong pa ma yin na ni /

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod dam /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la dngos po ma mchis so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so!

original: chos thams cad la dngos po med na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dngos po med na /
translated: If all phenomena are non-entities,

original: sems can gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: sems can gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: what sentient beings will the bodhisattva great beings establish in the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid dam /🔽rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / dgra bcom pa nyid dam / rang byang chub bam /
translated: the result of non-returner,🔽the state of a worthy one,🔽the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'god par bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'god par bya ste /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gzhan du na phyin ci log gis yongs su 'khris pa'i skye dgu dag phyin ci log med pa la gzhog go /
analyzed: gzhan du na phyin ci log gis yongs su 'khris pa'i skye dgu dag phyin ci log med pa la gzhog go /
translated: Other than that, they will establish beings who are entangled in error in the absence of error,

original: 'dul lo // rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: 'dul lo // rab tu 'god do //
translated: they will tame them, and they will establish them.

original: phyin ci log gang yin pa de'ang rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log gang yin pa de'ang rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because those errors arise from the cause of conceptualization.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not a perversion.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa ni /
translated: It is non-conceptual.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a perversion.

original: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la @385b bdag med do //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la @385b bdag med do //
translated: Where there is no perversion, there is no self.

original: sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can med do //
translated: There are no sentient beings.

original: srog med do //
analyzed: srog med do //
translated: There is no life-force.

original: 'gro ba med do //🔽gso ba med do //🔽skyes bu med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba med do // gso ba med do // skyes bu med do //
translated: There is no person.🔽There is no human.

original: gang zag med do //🔽shed can med do //
analyzed: gang zag med do // shed can med do //
translated: There is no human being.

original: shed bdag med do //
analyzed: shed bdag med do //
translated: There is no individual.🔽There is no one who does.

original: byed pa po med do; ;tshor ba po med do //
analyzed: byed pa po med do; ;tshor ba po med do //
translated: There is no one who feels.

original: shes pa po med do //
analyzed: shes pa po med do //
translated: There is no one who knows.

original: mthong ba po med do //
analyzed: mthong ba po med do //
translated: There is no one who sees.

original: de la gzugs med do //
analyzed: de la gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form.

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do //
translated: There is no perception.

original: 'du byed med do //
analyzed: 'du byed med do //
translated: There are no formative factors.

original: rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: There is no consciousness.

original: de la skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams med do //
analyzed: de la skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams med do //
translated: There are no sense fields. There are no elements. There is no dependent origination.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med do //
translated: There are no perfections. There are no emptinesses. There are no factors of awakening.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: “In it there are no Four Noble Truths, no concentrations, no immeasurables, no formless absorptions, no deliverances, no sequential meditative absorptions, no emptiness, no signlessness,

original: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams med do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams med do //
translated: no wishlessness, no higher knowledges, no meditative stabilities, and no dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad med do //
translated: “In it there are no ten powers of the tathāgatas, no four fearlessnesses, no four detailed and thorough knowledges, no great love, no great compassion, and no eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med do //
translated: “In it there is no knowledge of all aspects up to no knowledge of the path.🔽“

original: gang la gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / @386a *//🔽gang la skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang / gang la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /🔽de la gnas shing /
analyzed: gang la gzugs med pa dang / tshor ba med pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du byed med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / @386a *// gang la skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa dang / gang la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams med pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de / de la gnas shing /
translated: where there is no suffering, no origination, no cessation, no path, no wisdom, no attainment, and no nonattainment;🔽where there is no ignorance and also no extinction of ignorance, and so on up to: no aging and death and also no extinction of aging and death;

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de /
translated: where there is no suffering, no origination, no cessation, no path, no wisdom, no attainment, and no nonattainment;🔽where there is no Buddha, no Dharma, and no Saṅgha;🔽where there is no śrāvaka, no pratyekabuddha, and no buddha;🔽where there is no giving, no ethics, no patience, no perseverance, no concentration, and no wisdom;

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: where there is no perfect enlightenment, no turning of the wheel of Dharma, and no śrāvakas, no pratyekabuddhas, and no bodhisattvas;🔽where there is no world of gods, no world of humans, no world of Yama, and no world of hells;🔽where there is no world of the past, no world of the future, and no world of the present;🔽where there is no world of the inner and no world of the outer;🔽where there is no world of the conditioned and no world of the unconditioned;🔽where there is no world of the world and no world of the world beyond;🔽where there is no world of the world beyond and no world of the world beyond beyond;🔽where there is no world of the world beyond beyond and no world of the world beyond beyond beyond;🔽where there is no world of the world beyond beyond beyond and no world of the world beyond beyond beyond beyond;🔽where there is no world of the world beyond beyond beyond beyond and no world of the world beyond beyond beyond beyond beyond;🔽where there is no world of the world beyond beyond beyond beyond beyond and no world of the world beyond beyond beyond beyond beyond beyond;

original: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams /🔽sems can gyi 'du shes las 'grel te /
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnams /🔽sems can gyi 'du shes las 'grel te /
translated: where there is

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'grel to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'grel to //
translated: He is free from the notion of form.

original: gzugs med par 'du shes pa las 'grel to //
analyzed: gzugs med par 'du shes pa las 'grel to //
translated: He is free from the notion of the formless.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bar las 'grel to; ;gang zag pa med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi bar las 'grel to; ;gang zag pa med pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: He is free from all conditioned things, up to and including all conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: He is free from the dharmas that are the factors of awakening, the three gates of liberation, the four noble truths, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, all the meditative stabilities, and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang de la don dam pa'i @386b rnam pa gang yin pa de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang de la don dam pa'i @386b rnam pa gang yin pa de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The doors of dhāraṇī, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not ultimately as they are.

original: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, this unconditioned, unborn, insubstantial, and non-arisen is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
translated: That is the enlightenment of the blessed buddhas.

original: de la bdag med do //
analyzed: de la bdag med do //
translated: There is no self in that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzhan du na rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa las lam gyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni gzhan du na rang bzhin stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa las lam gyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa med de /
translated: That bodhisattva great being does not, in any other way, enter into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for the sake of the path, from the thorough knowledge of the emptiness of a basic nature.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de'ang snga nas kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid /🔽phyin chad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid de'ang snga nas kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid / phyin chad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid /
translated: That emptiness of a basic nature is also from the beginning empty of a basic nature.🔽It is also in the future empty of a basic nature.

original: bar du'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: bar du'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: It is also in the middle empty of a basic nature.

original: de nam yang rang bzhin gyis mi stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nam yang rang bzhin gyis mi stong pa ma yin no //
translated: It is never not empty of a basic nature.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /🔽sems can du @387a *//
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing / sems can du @387a *//
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva great being, practicing the perfection of the emptiness of a basic nature,

original: 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams kyi /
analyzed: 'du shes pa'i sems can rnams kyi /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings who have the idea of sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to free the idea of sentient beings of sentient beings,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod do //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod do //
translated: practices the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa'i tshe / 'di lta ste /
translated: When they practice the knowledge of the aspects of the path,🔽they practice all the paths,

original: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / lam thams cad la spyod de /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / lam thams cad la spyod de /
translated: namely, the śrāvaka path, the pratyekabuddha path, the bodhisattva path, and all the paths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings, having completed all the paths,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas /
translated: having brought beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas /
translated: having purified a buddhafield,

original: de'i tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: bless the life-forming winds at that time,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / 'di lta ste /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽they do not cut off the stream of the way of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: namely, the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul te /
translated: This is the way of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

analyzed: gnod sems can rnams la bzod pa'i gtam byed do //

analyzed: le lo can rnams la brtson 'grus kyi gtam byed do //

analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa rnams la shes rab kyi gtam byed do //

translated: When those sentient beings have been established in generosity, and in moral discipline, patient acceptance, perseverance, meditative concentration, and wisdom,

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: they teach the Dharma to sentient beings with skillful means.🔽Subhūti said,

analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings de bzhin du gnas pa ste /

analyzed: 'gro ba'ang med /

analyzed: gso ba'ang med / skyes bu'ang med / gang zag kyang med /

original: de bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: They themselves give gifts.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: They encourage others to give gifts.

original: sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: They speak in praise of giving gifts.

original: sems can gzhan gang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod de /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar spyod de /
translated: They speak in praise of others giving gifts as well, welcoming it.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de /
translated: In that way bodhisattva great beings

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa chen po byin zhing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa chen po byin zhing /
translated: give such great gifts.

original: rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
translated: He is reborn in a great and exalted family of nobles,

original: bram ze che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
analyzed: bram ze che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //
translated: in a great and exalted family of brahmins,

original: khyim bdag che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o //🔽khams kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag che zhing mtho ba'i rigs dang skal ba mnyam par skye'o // khams kyi rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: in a great and exalted family of householders,🔽and becomes a king of a region,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'thob bo //
translated: or a universal monarch.

original: de de dag na'ang sems can de dag /
analyzed: de de dag na'ang sems can de dag /
translated: And there, he gathers beings to himself

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su sdud de /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su sdud de /
translated: through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyad pa dang / don mthun pas yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyad pa dang / don mthun pas yongs su sdud do //
translated: Generosity, kind talk, meaningful actions, and practicing what one preaches.

original: de de ltar sbyin pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can de dag kyang rim gyis tshul khrims la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: de de ltar sbyin pas yongs su bsdus pa'i sems can de dag kyang rim gyis tshul khrims la rab tu 'god do //
translated: And those beings whom he has gathered through generosity, he gradually establishes in morality,

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la rab tu 'god do //
translated: in patience, in perseverance, in concentration, and in wisdom.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu 'god do //
translated: They establish them in the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul @409b gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul @409b gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: They establish them in the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang; rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang; rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang /
translated: They establish them in the four noble truths, the eight liberations, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation, and the five superknowledges.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rab tu 'god do //
translated: They establish them in the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: yang dag pa'i skyon med par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon med par 'jug par byed do //
translated: and they introduce them to the unmistaken, perfect way.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par byed do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par byed do //
translated: They cause them to attain the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.

original: rang byang chub thob par byed do //
analyzed: rang byang chub thob par byed do //
translated: They cause them to attain pratyekabuddhahood.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: They exhort them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: kye skyes bu dag /
analyzed: kye skyes bu dag /
translated: “O beings!

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dka' ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dka' ste /
translated: Unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is not hard to fully awaken to.

original: phyin ci log gis rmongs pa'i sems can rnams kyis khong du mi chud pa ma gtogs par chos gang la sems can rnams chags par gyur pa'i chos de lta bu gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa med kyi /
analyzed: phyin ci log gis rmongs pa'i sems can rnams kyis khong du mi chud pa ma gtogs par chos gang la sems can rnams chags par gyur pa'i chos de lta bu gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa med kyi /
translated: Except for sentient beings confused by error, no dharma whatsoever exists by way of its own essence, any dharma to which sentient beings might become attached.

original: phyin ci log gi 'dzin pa thams cad rgyun chod la 'khor ba las bdag cag kyang thar par gyis shig /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'dzin pa thams cad rgyun chod la 'khor ba las bdag cag kyang thar par gyis shig /
translated: Cut off all grasping at error and liberate yourselves from cyclic existence!”

original: gzhan yang thar par gyis shig /
analyzed: gzhan yang thar par gyis shig /
translated: You should also liberate others.

original: de ltar khyed kyang don chen por gyis shig /🔽gzhan yang don chen @410a *//
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyang don chen por gyis shig / gzhan yang don chen @410a *//
translated: In this way, you should also make your life meaningful.

original: po la sbyor cig ces yang dag par bskul bar byed de /
analyzed: po la sbyor cig ces yang dag par bskul bar byed de /
translated: You should also connect others to what is meaningful.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya ste /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of generosity.

original: de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice in this way,

original: ci nas kyang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: they practice in such a way that from the time they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment

original: nam yang ngan song du mi ltung ba dang / nam yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mi byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
analyzed: nam yang ngan song du mi ltung ba dang / nam yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po mi byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod do //
translated: they never fall into the lower realms and never fail to become a universal monarch.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa bon ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa bon ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu 'byung ste /
translated: The fruit arises in accordance with the seed.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de'i drung du slong mo pa gang ji snyed cig 'ongs kyang /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de'i drung du slong mo pa gang ji snyed cig 'ongs kyang /
translated: No matter how many beggars come before that universal monarch,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: that universal monarch thinks like this:

original: bdag gis sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par gzhan gyi don du 'khor los sgyur ba yongs su ma bzung ngo zhes de 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can rnams kyi don ma gtogs par gzhan gyi don du 'khor los sgyur ba yongs su ma bzung ngo zhes de 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: I do not take up the status of a universal monarch for my own sake, but only for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings.

original: su ci 'dod pa de khyed byin gyi 'di ni nga'i ma yin gyi khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: su ci 'dod pa de khyed byin gyi 'di ni nga'i ma yin gyi khyed kyi'o //
translated: Whatever anyone needs, I will give it to them. This is not my property, it is yours.

original: nga ni nang gi gzugs la'ang don du gnyer ba med na /
analyzed: nga ni nang gi gzugs la'ang don du gnyer ba med na /
translated: I do not even pursue my own physical well-being,

original: gzhan la lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzhan la lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone that of others.

original: gzhan du na ngas sems can rnams kyi don du 'khor ba yongs su bzung gi /
analyzed: gzhan du na ngas sems can rnams kyi don du 'khor ba yongs su bzung gi /
translated: I take up cyclic existence for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings,

original: bdag gi don du ni 'khor ba don du gnyer ba ma yin no zhes te /
analyzed: bdag gi don du ni 'khor ba don du gnyer ba ma yin no zhes te /
translated: but I do not pursue cyclic existence for my own sake.

original: de snying brtse bas snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: de snying brtse bas snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: Thus, with compassion, he perfects great compassion.

original: snying rje chen pos sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang /
translated: With great compassion, he accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can gang yongs su grub pa de lta bu mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can gang yongs su grub pa de lta bu mi dmigs te /
translated: However, he does not observe any sentient being that is established.

original: gzhan du na 'du shes dang / ming dang tha snyad kyis rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'du shes dang / ming dang tha snyad kyis rnam par spyod do //
translated: He engages in activity only through the perception of conceptual thought and designation.

original: rnam par spyod pa de'ang sgra @410b brnyan lta bur rnam par spyad du med par shes so //
analyzed: rnam par spyod pa de'ang sgra @410b brnyan lta bur rnam par spyad du med par shes so //
translated: He knows that this practice is like an echo, and that it cannot be practiced.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is how bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of generosity.

original: spyod pa'i tshe ci nas kyang bdag gi sha yan chad kyang sems can rnams la yongs su ma gtang ba med par bya na /
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshe ci nas kyang bdag gi sha yan chad kyang sems can rnams la yongs su ma gtang ba med par bya na /
translated: When they practice, they should practice so that they do not hold back even their own flesh, let alone external things, for the sake of sentient beings.

original: phyi rol gyi yo byad gang gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bya ba dag lta smos su'ang med pa de ltar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yo byad gang gis sems can rnams 'khor ba las yongs su thar bar bya ba dag lta smos su'ang med pa de ltar spyad par bya'o //
translated: They should practice so that they can liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence with whatever external things are necessary.

original: gsol pa / yo byad de dag gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / yo byad de dag gang lags /
translated: ” He asked, “What are those things?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: “The perfection of generosity is a necessary thing.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are equipment.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni yo byad do //🔽phyi stong pa nyid ni yo byad do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni yo byad do // phyi stong pa nyid ni yo byad do //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is equipment.🔽The emptiness of external phenomena is equipment.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni yo byad do //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni yo byad do //
translated: The emptiness of both external and internal phenomena is equipment.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni yo byad do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni yo byad do //
translated: Up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is equipment.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni yo byad do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni yo byad do //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are equipment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /🔽@411a *// smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni yo byad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang; tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / @411a *// smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni yo byad do //
translated: the four noble truths,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni yo byad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni yo byad do //
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the liberations, the correct and discerning choices, the dharani entrances, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni yo byad de /
analyzed: de dag ni yo byad de /
translated: “These are the provisions.

original: yo byad de dag gis sems can rnams yongs su bsdus shing /
analyzed: yo byad de dag gis sems can rnams yongs su bsdus shing /
translated: “With these provisions, they gather beings around them.

original: rim gyis nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rim gyis nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: Then, gradually, they cause them to enter the Hearers’ Vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Solitary Buddhas’ Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'am /
translated: or the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa gsum po de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po de dag gis yongs su mya ngan las zlo ste /
translated: They cause them to go forth to the three vehicles.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of giving

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa pas sems can rnams yongs su sdud pa yin no //🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa pas sems can rnams yongs su sdud pa yin no // rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
translated: gather beings with the perfection of giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving

original: sems can rnams tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: join beings to the perfection of morality?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of giving

original: sems can rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
translated: give gifts to beings.

original: de sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: When they give that gift

original: 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: they say this:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: ‘Come here, sons of a good family!

original: tshur gshegs tshul khrims srungs shig /
analyzed: tshur gshegs tshul khrims srungs shig /
translated: Protect your morality!

original: ngas @411b khyed zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / khyim dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang /
analyzed: ngas @411b khyed zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / mal cha dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / khyim dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang /
translated: I will make sure that you are not lacking in food, drink, clothes, bedding, flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, houses, wealth, grain, jewels, pearls,🔽cat’s eyes,

original: bee d'urya dang / dud dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul dang / mi'i yo byad kyi rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar gyis phongs pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: bee d'urya dang / dud dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul dang / mi'i yo byad kyi rkyen dang / yo byad gang ci'ang rung ba'i bar gyis phongs pa med par bya'o //
translated: crystals, coral, gold, silver, or any human necessities whatsoever.

original: khyed kyang phongs pas tshul khrims ngan pa la spyod grang na /
analyzed: khyed kyang phongs pas tshul khrims ngan pa la spyod grang na /
translated: If you are lacking in necessities and so engage in bad behavior,

original: khyed yo byad thams cad dang / rin po che bdun gyi bar gyis phongs pa med par bya'i /
analyzed: khyed yo byad thams cad dang / rin po che bdun gyi bar gyis phongs pa med par bya'i /
translated: I will make sure that you are not lacking in any necessities, up to and including the seven precious substances.

original: des khyed sdom pa'i tshul khrims ma nos la /
analyzed: des khyed sdom pa'i tshul khrims ma nos la /
translated: You have not taken up the vows of discipline,

original: rim gyis nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rim gyis nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: and you will gradually enter the Way of the Disciples,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'am /
translated: the Way of the Solitary Sages,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi theg pa'am /
translated: or the Way to the Knowledge of All Modes.

original: theg pa gsum po de dag gis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig ces nas /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po de dag gis sdug bsngal gyi mthar phyin par gyis shig ces nas /
